Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory423.jpg'}
{3: 'Three hours ago.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rebecca', 3: 'So relaxing. You must be ready for retirement.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Rebecca slams a folder of documents on the tea table, causing the cups on top to tremble.'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Collins', 3: "That's actually an option, but for someone in my position, I probably won't be able to enjoy my tea like now, even if I retire. So, let's just take it easy while we can.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Collins hands a cup of freshly brewed black tea to the beautiful woman, but she seems completely untouched.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rebecca', 3: "You pulled that Gray Raven Commandant in to stop Liszt's plan. But I don't think you came out unscathed, either. It was a lose-lose situation at most.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Collins', 3: "Let me taste this... Tss—so bitter. It's probably worse than your mood, Rebecca.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: "Rebecca's anger becomes increasingly visible. She seems to be losing patience."}

{2: 'Rebecca', 3: "I must remind you that the lunar base is almost fully restored. Liszt may seize the opportunity to make a comeback any time. You'll be lucky if Babylonia can take back control of the lunar base and the zero-point reactor, but I don't think Norman will give up their power so easily.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Still smiling, Collins adds a ridiculous amount of sugar to his tea and stirs carefully, waiting for the sugar to fully dissolve.'}

{2: 'Rebecca', 3: "I don't understand why you can remain so calm... If things continue this way, I may have to reconsider my plans. Remember, I don't hold any stake in this. All I need is a friend with influence. I don't care who this friend is.", 4: '1'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Collins', 3: 'Of course. All humans were born free, including you and me... If you think Liszt would be a better "friend," you are more than welcome to side with him. After all, I can\'t live without sweets, and I am prepared to defy the world just for my sweet little enjoyment. I don\'t mind having another enemy.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Collins bursts into laughter. He adds a lot of sugar to Rebecca's cup."}
{2: 'Collins', 3: "But I think you are a smart person. Why don't you enjoy this sweet taste first?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Collins taps on the spot next to him. Rebecca reluctantly sits down with a big frown. As she is about to pick up the cup, Collins continues to talk in a relaxed tone.'}

{2: 'Collins', 3: 'To be honest, Liszt did find an excellent opportunity, and credit where credit\'s due. I temporarily lost Luna, but without his "care," they wouldn\'t have directly halted all my Ascendant-related projects.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Collins', 3: "Still, I didn't completely overlook the possibility of losing Kurono's trust one day, so I haven't lost everything here... The document I asked you to get is my bargaining chip.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Collins picks up the folder that Rebecca dropped on the table. He opens it slowly, takes a deep breath in, and smiles, as if it were a bottle of aged wine that has just been opened.'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Rebecca', 3: 'Are you going to use these records of past experiments as a bargaining chip? I did my research. None of them had any valid conclusion... Has age caught up with you and made you forget what they are?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Collins', 3: "Forget? I can still remember every single experiment that I witnessed. I only asked you for help because I didn't want anyone to notice me.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Collins', 3: 'The resources and manpower we invested in this project are beyond imagination. It was a pity that we never fully understood the Inver-Device, but the by-products of this experiment—like Luna—led me to this speculation that the emergence of Ascendants could be related to the Inver-Device.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: 'Unfortunately, even Dr. Kalon was unable to completely decipher the theories of Inver-Device... Without data to prove it, this only remains my personal guess.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Collins', 3: 'But from the conversation we had with Luna in the lunar base, she seemed to know about the secrets of the Inver-Device. This suggests that the theory of Inver-Device could well be related to the Ascension-Network.', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory589.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Luna', 3: 'So it was you who turned me into a Corrupted...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Collins', 3: 'Of course not. You were an accident... Or, should I say, a necessary sacrifice.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: "Dr. Kalon's research had greatly increased the Construct tech's chance of success, but it still had flaws...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: '"Necessary sacrifice"...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Luna', 3: 'So you saw that as an "accident," huh... Well, it doesn\'t matter anymore.', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory423.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Collins', 3: 'The accident in the lunar base cost us Luna... Maybe we will never find out the answer from her.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'With a bitter and sorrowful look, Collins shakes his head hard, trying to forget this cruel fact at least temporarily.'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: "Therefore... it doesn't matter that the Ascendant projects are temporarily halted. I can still take the path of Inver-Device. All I have to do is conquer it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: 'The remaining value of the past investments can still be utilized.', 4: '1'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Rebecca', 3: "But hadn't you already recovered some experiment data previously? The Construct development team had some thoughts, but the team studying Inver-Device never made much progress.", 4: '1'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Collins', 3: 'The data from this series of experiments was never completely recovered. Vesalius only has access to the top-priority data or the data that cannot be disclosed externally.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: 'Because they halted the research, they also put the recovery of experiment data to a lower priority.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Collins', 3: "Two heads are better than one. No matter how good Vesalius is in the field of Construct research, there have to be some experiments and data that she cannot complete on her own... But she wouldn't be willing to work with the Science Council.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Collins', 3: "The Parliament wants to maintain a good image, so they won't be able to do the experiments themselves. However, they have also privately inquired about this data. In other words, it can help them to exclude some of the incorrect answers that cannot be identified through simulation.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rebecca', 3: 'Incorrect answers? Are you implying... that the Parliament is also prioritizing the research on the Inver-Device now?', 4: '1'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Collins', 3: 'Not now... They have always been doing so. The Science Council wants to fully understand the Inver-Device because it is the foundation of all Construct theories...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: 'Despite their constant adjustments to the Inver-Device, they never have a clear understanding of it, making this data valuable to them.', 4: '1'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Rebecca', 3: "If that's the case... Are you planning to use this thing to negotiate and strike a deal with the Parliament? Honestly, I don't think the Parliament would share their research with us just because of some data of unknown origin.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Collins', 3: "I never said there would be a deal. If the Parliament doesn't send us their research results, we can bring ours to them.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rebecca', 3: 'What can we get from this, then?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Collins', 3: 'We only have part of the key to this treasure. If we can unlock the treasure by sharing our key, we will be able to at least see the treasure with our own eyes.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: "Don't you understand? We don't have to reveal the secrets of Inver-Device ourselves. Whoever ends up first will have to share their results in the end.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: 'This is about the well-being of the entire humankind. Even if someone wants to keep it to themselves, the World Government has many ways to make them share.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: 'To sum up, the theories of the Inver-Device and the information about Ascendants we got from Luna are the two core pieces in our puzzle.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: 'Getting things done is like tasting tea. The best time to start is probably when the heat has cooled down a little.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Collins finishes the cooled tea in his cup and calls a number.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory545.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Celica', 3: "...That's the end of the weekly summary sent by the research team.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Given the current level of manpower investment, this progress can be considered acceptable. Is that what the research team is trying to say?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'In other words, there is no significant breakthrough yet.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'The study of the Inver-Device has always been based on luck. We have always been gambling with fate.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'If we are to meet all the benchmarks set for that frame, we must conquer the mysteries of the Inver-Device.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Yeah, I know.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The new specialized frame designed and fitted for Lee from Gray Raven is going through an urgent but challenging research progress.'}
{3: 'Unlike Empyrea, which almost killed its user, this new specialized frame is designed with the hope that it can make its user completely immune to the Punishing Virus.'}
{3: "If this frame works, it means humans can at least stand tall on the path of fighting the Punishing Virus, and humanity's comeback finally starts in a real sense."}

{3: "One of the major drawbacks of Empyrea was that the equipped Inver-Device could not keep up with the Omega Weapon's speed of absorbing the Punishing Virus, and eventually the accumulated virus would damage the user."}
{3: 'If the parameters of the Inver-Device can be optimized based on the user\'s needs, the new specialized frame could possibly "neutralize" the negative effects of the Punishing Virus.'}
{3: 'Which is why the research on the Inver-Device has been prioritized once again.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: 'What about the surface? Any good news?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Celica shakes her head and smiles bitterly.'}
{2: 'Celica', 3: 'There is no worse news... Can we consider that as good news?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The meeting room falls into silence for a moment. The hot vapor from the coffee and the cold air from the ventilation system blend together, taking heat away from the cup.'}
{2: 'Celica', 3: "Wait, I'm getting incoming comms... It's the man from Kurono. Should I hang up?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: 'No. Patch him through.', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory423.jpg'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory545.jpg', 2: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab', 3: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Collins', 3: "Greetings, President. It's been a while. And you too, Nicky... I can feel your tension through the screen.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "What are you up to, Collins? I'm going to hang up if you are only here for chit-chat. Unlike you, we are very busy right now.", 4: '11'}
{3: 'After the emergency meeting about the lunar base ended, Collins suddenly disappeared for some time, just like how he suddenly showed up in the meeting.'}

{3: '"Collins\' influence is slowly being eroded. Kurono has shifted toward Liszt." This rumor does not come out of nowhere. Nobody knows what Collins would do when he is cornered, so Nikola and Hassen have to carefully think of the real purpose behind his call.'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: "No, I'm not here to catch up. But who knows? Perhaps Nicky here would buy me dinner after this... After all, I bear good tidings.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The monitor shows that Collins is trying to send over an encrypted file. Hassen and Nikola exchange a look before nodding, gesturing to Celica to accept the file.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Good tidings, huh? How timely.', 4: '11'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: "This document I have with me contains classified data from the early days of Kurono's research... You must have guessed what it is about—Inver-Device.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Seeing Hassen and Nikola quickly glance at each other, Collins sounds even more ecstatic.'}

{2: 'Collins', 3: 'This was the record from our earliest experiments, purely authentic data collected from real subjects. Surely you know how much of a difference it makes using actual data instead of the estimated ones nowadays, right?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: '...Real subjects?', 4: '11'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Nikola', 3: "It's against the law to experiment on Constructs... If the Control Court gets ahold of this document, you can spend the rest of your life in a cell.", 4: '11'}

{2: 'Collins', 3: "Which is why this data is so valuable! Don't get me wrong—all these experiments were done long before the Construct Protection Protocol was established. Progress requires sacrifices, but I'm still a law-abiding citizen.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'What would you like as a reward?', 4: '11'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: "Can't I just be in a giving mood, Nicky?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: 'As I said—progress. All I want is for humanity to uncover the secrets of the Inver-Device.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Collins', 3: "I'm even willing to let you guys get your hands on the first-hand data yourselves! How's that for good faith? And I trust the Parliament will repay me with the original data after recovering it and making a backup.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Recovering it? The data is on the surface?', 4: '11'}

{2: 'Collins', 3: 'Obviously. We established many shelters when the war started, and many children we helped thank us by volunteering in our M.I.N.D. and Inver-Device research. Dear, it always moves me to tears whenever I talk about this.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Collins lowers his head as he speaks, pretending to be devastated.'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: "Unfortunately, we didn't have enough time to prepare for the Evacuation, and many pieces of valuable data were left behind on the surface, waiting to be recovered.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: "You'll receive the coordinates of a shelter soon. Send someone down, and you'll get your data.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Nikola watches Collins\' expression, hoping to find the catch of his "kindness."'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: 'You break my heart, Nicky, the way you look at me. And I thought there was some trust between us!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: "Or maybe you're hoping I'll get my hands dirty as well? Hmm... I can designate the Construct involved in this recovery mission. How about that?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'After thinking briefly, Collins grins.'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: "Here's a thought, Nicky... Vera from Cerberus. What do you say?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'Why Vera? She has nothing to do with Kurono anymore.', 4: '11'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: "Yeah, yeah. But there's no one better than her if we're investigating a Kurono facility, right?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "Hmph... What's Vera doing now, Celica?", 4: '11'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Celica', 3: "Vera... She just completed an operation two days ago. She's on standby currently.", 4: '11'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Alright. Any other Constructs on standby right now?', 4: '12'}
{2: 'Celica', 3: "Let me check. There's Bambinata from Egret, and there's Dark Aries...", 4: '11'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: "Alright, then. We'll send Bambinata and Vera. It's going to be safer and more effective to send them both, given how hostile it still is down there.", 4: '12'}
{2: 'Celica', 3: "Understood. I'll start preparing the mission details.", 4: '11'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: "It's a deal, then? Oh, wait, I forgot—this isn't a deal. I'll await your good tidings.", 4: '1'}
{1: '2', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory423.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Nikola', 3: "It's risky to do this without first figuring out what he is after.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: "I know. But the best way to figure out what he's planning is to be there when he makes every move.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Hassen', 3: "You and I both know about those Kurono experiments. We even mentioned acquiring those data, given their usefulness—we just didn't expect Collins to hand over them himself. And I remember a proposal regarding Vera...?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "That proposal? I'll send it to her.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'The Construct from Egret... Are we sure about sending her with Vera?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Do you still remember her background?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "I do. Her current state won't be very helpful, however.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: "If this is a game of chess, let's make sure we utilize all our pieces to their fullest.", 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory423.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rebecca', 3: 'The Cerberus Captain? Did you get involved with the Task Force last time?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: "Vera has always given me a good impression, that's all.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Rebecca', 3: "Then why put her name forward? You should've avoided the Parliament's attention if you want to recruit her. I still remember Atlantis when she...", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Collins', 3: 'Nicky and Vera are both people from Kurono, and anyone who was part of Kurono won\'t forget that the strongest bond is profit. No doggo doesn\'t obey when it\'s their profit on the line... I\'m just curious to see how strong their "bond" is.', 4: '2'}

{3: 'Collins remembers that Hassen also appointed another Construct whose name sounded familiar. With his faint recollection, he pulls up another file, and he cannot stop laughing after going through two pages.'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: 'Bambinata? Hahaha—', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Rebecca', 3: 'What are you laughing at?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: 'Nothing. Just serendipity.', 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory211.png'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vera.', 3: "I'm confused. Do we really need two Constructs for this?", 4: '1'}
{3: "The door to the transport craft slowly opens. The unique scent of sanitizer rushes out of the aircraft, gently sending Vera's red hair blowing in the wind."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory545.jpg', 2: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab', 3: '2'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Celica', 3: "Vera... The situation on the surface is quite complicated right now. President Hassen and Chief Commander Nikola are hoping that you and Bambinata can watch each other's back and return as quickly as possible.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vera.', 3: "I'm not the only one with questions here, am I? Dollface here must be equally perplexed, despite not saying a word.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Vera points her terminal at Bambinata.'}
{2: 'Bambinata', 3: 'Bambinata has no objections regarding the mission.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bambinata', 3: 'But Bambinata is capable of accomplishing it herself if needed.', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: "I'll take it from here, Celica."}

{1: '1', 2: 'Nikola', 3: 'The mission was an impromptu decision. There were no scouting efforts beforehand, hence the current deployment to minimize the chance of accidents during the operation.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'If you still have questions, I can answer them at a suitable time in a suitable way. Period.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Celica', 3: "...We're counting on you, Vera, Bambinata.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab', 4: '2'}
{3: "Celica may sound gentle, but Vera could feel the finality in Nikola's words. Not to mention..."}

{3: 'Either this apparently simple mission is a messy political move, and Vera is dragged into it by forces beyond her control—the puppet-like Construct before her may be sent here to monitor her...'}
{3: 'Or... the "suitable time" and "suitable way" Nikola said were not just words to reassure her.'}
{3: 'Vera turns her gaze toward her well-prepared teammate. Bambinata has been sitting in the back of the transport craft and waiting for Vera to finish her call ever since the aircraft arrived.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vera.', 3: '...Hey, which squad are you from again?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bambinata', 3: "Mistress' team is called Egret.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vera.', 3: 'Mistress? Hahaha—that has a nice ring to it. I should get Noctis to start practicing.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera.', 3: "Does your mistress dress you like that so you Egrets can play house when there's no mission?", 4: '1'}
{3: "Bambinata does not respond to Vera's tease, and Vera stops trying to get Bambinata to talk."}
{3: 'Clear footsteps can be heard coming from afar. Right as the door to the transport craft is about to close, a foot stomps onto the slow-rising platform.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bambinata', 3: 'Mistress? How come...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vanessa', 3: "I've been assigned as the commandant of the operation.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vanessa passes her terminal to Vera, showing Vera who is actually in charge here.'}

{2: 'Vera.', 3: "The Egret Commandant? Ah, I remember now. Isn't this the only member left on your team? Your mistress must value you a lot, so much so that she'd request to join a mission on the surface for her Construct.", 4: '2'}
{3: "Vera meets Vanessa's gaze, her grin slightly provoking."}
{2: 'Vera.', 3: "You're here right on time. I was trying to have a conversation with your Construct here.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Vanessa puts away her terminal elegantly, turning around and sitting down by Bambinata.'}
{3: 'Bambinata helps Vanessa put on her seatbelts attentively and gestures to the safety staff outside the transport craft to continue closing the door.'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'And what kind of bond has the Cerberus Captain formed with my Construct here?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vera.', 3: "We didn't start off on the right foot, but we have plenty of time here, don't we?", 4: '1'}
